main event: A military personnel at Pepperell AFB in Newfoundland sighted a bright, flashing red object in the sky for about 58 minutes on April 2, 1956.
interesting points: The object flashed very brightly at times, lighting up the sky for many miles, then faded to barely visible before becoming bright again.
The object was circular in shape and its motion was described as 'bobbing noticeably'.
The object was estimated to be at an altitude of 300 feet and moving at a speed of approximately 20 knots.
No radar contact was established with the object.
The report indicates that the sighting may have been of the planet Venus, as the object's behavior and color changes were similar to observations of an astronomical body.
sighted object: One round object, mostly red in color with other colors like orange and blue observed
witnesses: 8 military personnel, including a weather-trained sergeant
